summary: Paper trails are critical—but is all paperwork? The federal government funds the majority of the research conducted by colleges and universities—over $27 billion in fiscal year 2015. In turn, these organizations are required to develop budgets, document expenses, and demonstrate that they are spending this money appropriately. However, colleges and universities are concerned that the time and resources they spend complying with these requirements is...
title: Federal Research Grants: Opportunities Remain for Agencies to Streamline Administrative Requirements
